file_content.text: Watch your step. This war isn't just a free-for-all, you know.
Oh, great. Let me guess. Ethics violation? Bad people doing bad things, and it made you sad?
Every day the same scrag, day in and day out. Why me?
I need to talk to you about the minefield gambling.
I have something to report.
Aren't you the ethics officer?
Because it's your job?
Right. So that means I have to be the moral compass for an entire army of degenerates?
Bah. So what do you want?
Do you have any idea what the soldiers have found to bet on?
It's about the minefield.
There are troopers out at the minefield, blowing up refugees.
People are being exploded.
Nevermind, you're not going to care.
Forget it.
Well, that's one less thing to deal with today.
There are people gambling on exploding refugees!
People are dying!
You mean the minefield run, don't you? With those wretched refugees?
That minefield game has been shut down for months. I made sure of that personally.
Really?
Lo--look, I'm sure. I'd even go and check it out for you, except there are reports of dangerous explosions in the area--oh.
I was just there and it's definitely still running.
I've seen it.
You mean they started it back up? Without me finding out?
Nope--refugees blowing up everywhere.
People are still exploding.
Blast it! Those--I'll take care of this, don't you worry.
Here, there's a, uh, standing reward of credits for squealers--I mean, heh, I mean, information gatherers.
Thanks.
Yeah, sure. You, too.
This planet needs serious help.
This place is crazy.
You don't know the half of it.
Wow. Great reward.
I know, it's a blasted shame when a squealer can't make a living doing what he does best.
Look, if you got a complaint, fill out the paperwork. I'll get to it maybe next century.
